name: Hotel Langlois

reviews.title: A Gem Of A Hotel
reviews.text: A lovely hotel in a great location - the nearest Metro stop is Trinite which is only a few steps from the hotel and from there you can be in any part of the city in a very short time. The hotel is also only 5 minutes walk away from Blvd Haussman where you will find some of the major Paris department stores including Printemps and Galleries Lafeyette.

reviews.title: Lovely and convenient but not outstanding
reviews.text: Overall the hotel was clean and the staff were friendly and welcoming. The rooms are large and traditionally French (from the era of the Belle Epoche) and the rate per night is very reasonable. I would have no hesitation in recommending the Hotel Langlois no matter what the purpose of your trip, be it business or pleasure.

reviews.title: Loved the lift!
reviews.text: This is a nice hotel in a very good location, close to the big department stores, a few nice brasseries, and very close to the subway. To accomodate 2 relatively grown up children, we reserved a suite and got the one on the 4th floor, facing the street. We were also offered a studio on the 7th floor but decided not to try it. The room was very nice and clean and fairly large by Paris standards.

reviews.title: Wish we could have stayed longer!!! We loved it!!!
reviews.text: One of our problems was that the heat worked too well and we needed to open the window but the street was so noisy that we had to close it. So during the nights, we played open/close the window to maintain a relatively normal temperature in the room and to reduce the dryness.

reviews.title: Great Value for Money
reviews.text: The breakfast is a bit expensive for what they offer.

reviews.title: Enjoyed our stay very much
reviews.text: Stayed for 4 nights after seeing the review on Trip Advisor. We were very happy with the location. We were able to get around easily on the subway. A great way to get places in Paris! I loved using the Paris subway!! At first it seemed daunting but it took 1/2 day to learn it and we used it constantly. This hotel is also close to one of the main bus stops, St. Lazare. in Paris. The subway entrance is 1/2 block from the hotel. The hotel was built in 1879. the rooms were a bit older looking but were large, clean and very comfortable. Our bathroom had been recently remodeled and was very nice along with the staff. There were alot of nice restaurants close by. We were at first concerned because it was more northeast but we didn't really feel far away from anything. I would stay there again without a doubt!!!!

Great Location. Close to the Metro and close enought to most of the sites for those who prefer to see Paris from ground level ! - Louvre 20 mins, Place De Le Concord 15 mins. Staff very freindly could not do more to make our stay perfect. We stayed for Breakfast which at 09 euros was very good but if your prefer there are many good cafe's close by. From the airport get the Roissey bus, it drops you at the Opera which is 5-10 minutes walk.
reviews.title: Great Little Hotel

reviews.text: Room was very clean and tastefull furnished as was the hotel. This is not a chain hotel and thus may not appeal to all but if you are looking for a hotel that is a little bit of old France this is a great choice.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel

reviews.text: We have just returned from a weeks stay at the Hotel Langlois (July 15-22, 2005). It was a perfect hotel for us; a quiet neighborhood that became a sanctuary after the jam-packed sightseeing days, pleasant staff, very tastefully decorated common rooms with a wonderful little elevator, a comfortable bedroom with a quiet, remote-controlled air-conditioning unit, great thick towels in the bathroom, a view of Sacre Coeur, and even free internet access. The neighborhood provided all our needs--a quick half block to the Metro, two banks with ATM access within a half block, a post office a half block away, a little Brasserie for coffee and croissants in the morning (and even a decent dinner at night if you are too exhausted to return to the touristy areas) right next to the Metro entrance, a nice little patisserie, and only a few blocks from the renowned Galleries Lafayette Department Stores (foodies--you need to see the Galleries Lafayette Gourmet Foods department!) All in all, we were thrilled with this little hotel in the ninth arrondissement and will certainly return to it when we return to Paris.
reviews.title: Good Value Hotel in Paris

reviews.text: Stayed in this hotel in July 05 and I must say that like the other reviews this hotel is not luxury, but it is clean and has everything you need at good rates with big rooms and friendly staff.
reviews.title: Langlois is a classic
romantic
reviews.text: after 5 stays in this hotel and a few stays in other hotels in Paris i know this is the best for the price. Last WE we did not have the best room (14) but 98 € is not so much for this place. We will return !!

We just returned from 7 nights at this hotel in room 31 which had a double bed and a large bathroom. We had a twin bed added since there were 3 of us. The room was quiet and ample. There was no view, but that was okay. Breakfast was 9 euros which is better than in a restaurant for the food you get, but much easier to walk outside the hotel to the little patisserie close by and get a croissant and orange juice. Good place for lunch! The Trinite metro stop is the nearest one. Being in the 9th makes it a quieter hotel than most, but still convenient to attractions if you use the metro. The staff at the front desk understood English very well. The drinks in the refrigerator in the room are reasonably priced which is unusual for a hotel. I would definitely stay here again. There is computer access in the breakfast room as well. The cost for the room was 110 euros. There was no additional charge for the extra bed/person.
reviews.title: Perfect hotel

reviews.text: Just back from a one night stay at hotel Langois. Good quality for your money in the center of Paris. 5 min walk to the main shopping area.
reviews.title: cheap lodging in central Paris

reviews.text: 100 m. to the metro. For me 3 stars instead of 2!
reviews.title: Large rooms and fabulous views....

reviews.text: I'll upgrate it if we can have air-conditioning in the room. Very warm. Luckely we had a room at the backsite of the hotel with no streetnoise and could open a window. Seems that all rooms will have airco in july.
reviews.title: Great hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed in Paris for several night with our three young children. We had two rooms on the 4th floor and were pleasantly surprised by the quality owe found. We selected this hotel based on Trip Advisor reviews and we found exactly what people said we would ... an amazing little hotel, in a fantastic location, with beautiful rooms and friendly helpful staff. Our kids enjoyed riding the lift each day and I appreciated having access to teh internet to stay on top of work back home (although my wife constantly chastised me!) This hotel is a real gem and I wish I wasn't so glowing for fear I won't be able to get a reservation next time but it was simply outstanding value. The location was very convenient and just minuted from the Metro station. There was a bank machine and post office just down the street and excellent restaurants within a few metres of the hotel in every direction. My family amd I just had a dreamy vacation in Paris and I can't wait to go back to the Hotel Des Croises when we return to Paris again one day!
reviews.title: Incroyable Indeed! Loved this Paris hotel!

reviews.text: We stayed at Hotel Langlois based on reviews found on TripAdvisor. It exceeded all our expectations. We wanted a quiet place which was well-situated for a brief visit in Paris while we got over our jet lag. It offered a lot more.
reviews.title: Great Value, Good Location
Incroyable!!! We loved this hotel... more than worth the money.
reviews.text: We were able to get to the hotel by train from Aeroport Charles de Gaulle easily (40 mins) and quickly with our bags in tow. The hotel's location is between Opera Garnier and Montmarte on a quiet and safe street. The Metro is 50 steps away. It is near all the big department stores and has some nice cafes in the neighbourhood. The hotel's rooms are huge by European standards and some of the bathrooms (we were travelling with friends) are enormous by any standard. In the middle of summer - the air conditioning (remote controlled) was very efficient and QUIET! Their is also a small fridge in each room. The beds are great and cleaning staff keep the rooms immaculate. The buffet continental breakfast is quite nice and is not exhorbitantly priced compared to the cafes. The elevator is a wonderful relic that will hopefully stay in service for many more decades. Reception was friendly and efficient. There is also an internet computer available to guests (except during breakfast).

reviews.title: Below expectations
reviews.text: The downside is that there are very limited views and limited service in the hotel. The halls are a bit musty and the TVs are small with only a dozen channels.

If you came to Paris to enjoy getting out on the city and want a hotel offering great value (110 euros per room) and a sound sleep then this is it. You can spend your savings on great restaurants instead! By the way - try Deux Theatres - a five minute walk from Hotel Langlois.
reviews.title: Best Value in Paris

reviews.text: Now. This hotel is perfect. Really. Since there is no air condition in the rooms the hotel, by french standards, gets a maximum of two stars (one star?). The class is much higher though.
reviews.title: Very good indeed

reviews.text: I'm giving only 4 stars due to the fact that the hotel had accepted more reservations than they have rooms. We had to stay at Hotel Brittany the first night (out of four) and that was not a pleasant experience (avoid that hotel at any cost!). I figure this is something they do on a regular basis due to the popularity.
reviews.title: Paris without attitude
Excellent stay
reviews.text: Like many others I booked this based on the reviews from this website - and was not disappointed. The front desk staff could not have been more helpful - and even ensured we got to the airport on time despite the metre/RER strike, by warning us of the strike and then booking an early taxi.
Room on the 6th floor was wonderful - lots of character and with air conditioning – not that it was needed.
reviews.title: Well worth the wait.....
Elegance and Value
reviews.text: It is an old hotel and you do hear some noise from other rooms and the lift – and why some people need showers/baths at 6am on a Sunday ……

My family of 4 stayed at the Hotel Langlois for four nights. At first, I wasn't so sure about the neighborhood and being far from sites. But we weren't at all. We walked to everything, but took the subway back. The folks who work at the Langlois were very nice. We stayed in a suite that accomodated us well, but for the last night needed two seperate rooms since I made a mistake when I reserved. They did give us two rooms, moved our luggage for us, and gave us a very much coveted air-conditioned room! When I checked out and paid for our stay, I realized that they only charged us for the suite again for the last night! That saved a bit of money. I doubt that there is a better deal in Paris. In the neighborhood we picked up outstanding coissants for 1 euro. Breakfast for 1 euro? My children voted their stay in Paris the best of our 2 week adventure.
reviews.title: I agree!

reviews.text: Once we stepped in my wife and I both immediately recognized the lobby, reception, and elevator as the same hotel we had stayed at fifteen years ago as poor students. The hotel has a new name and is under new management, but our stay was every bit as pleasant as the first time. The new management has obviously put some money into the hotel, including air conditioning and art work. The rooms are large, the bathrooms are also large, the owners and staff are very friendly, and the breakfast is a reasonably good deal for Paris. Highly recommended.
reviews.title: Still nice after 15 years
Lovely hotel, lovely stay.
reviews.text: Hotel Langlois is a Parisian gem. The staff was very helpful and kind, the room was tastefully appointed and relatively quiet (no street noise and minimal noise from other rooms). The location is perfect and the price moderate. The computer in the lobby with Internet access was a big help to us. The bathtub in our room was perfect for a long, hot bubble bath to sooth our travel-weary bodies.

reviews.title: Wonderfully romantic Hotel Langlios
reviews.text: We also took advantage of what the surrounding neighborhood had to offer: the sandwich and pastry shops for breakfast and lunch, a self-service laundry just down the street, a corner sidewalk-cafe for sitting and watching the world rush past. With the metro, bus stop and taxi stand close by, we found this the hotel a convenient base from which to explore the city. AND it is within walking distance of shopping along Boulevard Hausmann: Printemps, the Galleries Lafayette and Marks & Spencer.

Yes, the hotel has its imperfections, but they only add to the quaint charm of this Parisian experience. We were there to see Paris and when we returned to our room at the Hotel Langlois each night we slept very well indeed!
reviews.title: Wonderful Find in Paris!!!
Loved it
reviews.text: Stayed at Hotel Langlois from 19-24 December. At a total cost of 446.54 euros including two lots of taxes but excluding breakky, I had an absolutely fantastic stay and thoroughly enjoyed what the hotel and Paris had to offer.

reviews.title: Worst European hotel experience we've ever had!
reviews.text: We stayed in Room 71. It is HUGE because it is basically half of the entire sixth floor with the dividing walls knocked down. Entry to Room 71 is via its kitchenette, complete with pots and pans, microwave and fridge; followed by the lounge room which had a table and 4 chairs, a TV, a futon sofabed and wardrobes; then twin bed bedroom with (another) TV, and finally a big bathroom with quite fancy towels and fawcett/basin. See the room pictures room and window views. On yeah, the lift is one of a kind.

reviews.title: easily twice the size of other places I've stayed in Paris
reviews.text: The receptionist girl was very friendly and helpful but she only works on certain shifts, and then a surly eastern European guy (who claims he speaks zero English) takes over from 6pm and everything goes downhill from there.

reviews.title: Great Hotel, Great Location
reviews.text: There is a fast computer with broadband internet and a CD/DVD burner (perfect if your digicam's memory cards are low) in the breakky room. It is free for all patrons.

reviews.title: Good value and great location
reviews.text: When you walk out of the front door, take two successive right turns and you will be outside a small supermarket. I went nuts on the French gummy bears.

reviews.title: good deal
reviews.text: I work for a major airline and have stayed at more than a few european hotels. This hotel was really a good deal. Nothing fancy, but very clean,very quiet, and a certain amount of charm. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The location is good for airport transfer, and a healthy, but pleasant walk to the Eiffel Tower.
We stayed at the Hotel Langlois last week for 3 nights on a holiday visit.
reviews.title: Close to everything
Great Stay
reviews.text: There were 7 in our party. My husband and I stayed in a double room, while my brother, his wife and their 3 children stayed in a suite which was very reasonably priced for so central a hotel. I had had a lot of trouble finding a budget hotel in central Paris that could accommodate my brother's family in one room, so after much searching on the web was delighted to see the reviews for the Hotel Langlois on this web site and took the chance of booking.

reviews.title: Good location and decent price!
reviews.text: We were all very happy with the hotel. It is perfectly situated for sight-seeing, and was within walking distance of the Louvre, Opera, Palais Royale, large department stores, the Roissy Bus, L'Open Tour Bus and Metro. There were a good number of restaurants (French and ethnic) nearby, though I would recommend trying to go further afield if you have a smaller party than ours, as we had difficulty finding any interesting or particularly French culinary treats close by apart from the cake shop next to the hotel and the creperie booth opposite the Trinity church. But the French restaurants nearby did offer good size portions of standard 'pub' fare and were helpful in regard to children's meals.

The hotel itself was very clean, the breakfast buffet was fresh and there was plenty of it, and the hotel has obviously gone through a recent refurbishment. There are also many pleasing period features retained throughout the building. Our only complaint was that the rooms were very warm at night. But the weather was unseasonably mild during our stay, so the heating system may not have been able to adjust.
reviews.title: Perfect play to stay
What a fabulous hotel
reviews.text: I stayed here in August 2004. I picked this hotel due to the reviews and was not disappointed. The location is excellent and the rooms were larger than I could have ever expected from a ** hotel. It was quaint, friendly staff and even though it was a hot summer, the rooms were cool. Paris is an expensive city so stay here and spend your money down the Champs Elysee! All the positive comments about this hotel are true - it is a fantastic find!

reviews.title: Not bad, good value
reviews.text: I stayed here with my wife over a weekend and overall I was pleased. On the plus side the hotel is in a great location. It's close to the RER, Saint Lazare line (just down the street) and it's right around the corner from the Metro 12 line, Trinity station. There are some cafe's around the place to buy a cheap (relatively speaking) breakfast and it's in a good, quiet area. I like the decor and the rooms and bathrooms were adequate in size. On the negative side, I'd have to say that I was disappointed with thickness of the walls and floors. I could hear people walking around upstairs, conversations in other rooms and out in the hallways as well as running water in the bathroom beside us. They cleaned our rooms every day but they didn't replace the towels which in the end isn't so bad but may bother others. Overall, I think I'd stay here again. I thought the price was reasonable at 96 euro per night.

reviews.title: Fantastic atmosphere.
reviews.text: We've just spent 2 nights at the Hotel Langlois. We stayed in room 41 which had a very large bathroom and over looked the courtyard at the back. The room was large too, particulary for Paris, and was warm if not a bit too warm! We took the Eurostar to Gard du Nord and the hotel was just 1 stop along on the ERE. The metro was just 2 minutes walk away. Would recommend it to anyone staying in Paris.

We've stayed here on a few occasions while in Paris and have always been very pleased. I have never stayed in a bigger room in Paris, nor perhaps in Europe, for that matter. This place allows you to actually move around instead of shimmying sideways to get from one side of the room to the other. The bathrooms and large and spacious too. There is a lift and though small, it does the trick.
reviews.title: Biggest and maybe even the best in Paris
Comfortable, Good value, Central
reviews.text: Unfortunately, and probably because it has grown so popular, it has gone up in price from when we paid around 79 euros with breakfast last year to this year where we most recently paid 96 euros with no breakfast. Still, for under 100 euro it is an amazing deal for Paris. You can walk to the Opera and the shopping streets easily and if there is anything out of your reach, the hotel is just around the corner from a metro stop, making gettting around very easy. This hotel will be the spice of your vacation.

reviews.title: a beautiful hotel and quiet ,good location ,safe
reviews.text: This has got to be the best hotel for the price.We had a standard room it was beautiful and clean.IT LOOKED LIKE THE WEBSITE.It had a black marble fireplace in the room with white marble reclining female nude statue and tall ceilings.It had a great bathroom, deep tub ,and a good bed.What more do u need for romance.The hotel is very special and has been the set for several movies.The hotel staff is very helpful. .The hotel is very close to Galleries Lafayette where we had breakfast every day on a terrace overlooking the Opera and Paris.Breakfast was cheaper by half at the department store.Have fun!

reviews.title: We love it..
reviews.text: My self and my husband we stayed here for 5 nights. This was our 3rd visit to Hotel Langlois.
We just love the location, the decor, the rooms and friendly staff.
reviews.title: A really happy Christmas!
No better for the price or more
reviews.text: We'll go back next year for sure.

My husband and I went to Paris along with two other couples this Christmas. We had an excellent stay at the Langlois. All three couples were very content with the rooms (again, exept from the over-heating) and we all found the location quite central.
reviews.title: Wonderful Hotel but Clangy Pipes at Night
Brilliant!
reviews.text: We stayed here from 3rd - 5th January and find it very hard to fault the place. First of all the location is superb. To get there we just got off the bus from Beauvais at Port Maillot where we went round the corner to the Metro station and bought our 3 day tickets. From Port Maillot we travelled on to Concorde where we changed for Trinite. Although we took a wee while to find the hotel it's really very easy to find if you know where to look. Just come up the steps of Trinite Metro and take the street on your right - Rue St. Lazare. It's just along there a bit. From this station you can get anywhere within minutes. It's also within easy walking distance of the Moulin Rouge and the Opera.

reviews.title: Not quite impressed
reviews.text: The hotel itself is very charming and we found the service to be excellent. The bed could be more comfortable but the room was huge and we had a shower, toilet, minibar and tv. We were lucky enough to have a room at the back so we didn't get much noise although it's in the middle of a big city so you should probably be prepared for that. Any time we asked for help at the reception we received it with a smile. My biggest tip would be to ask for a restaurant recommendation. You won't be disappointed.

reviews.title: Best deal in Paris
reviews.text: All in all if you want a place to rest your head for a decent price in the centre of Paris you can't really go wrong with this place.

reviews.title: You Can Do Better in Paris
reviews.text: I think one has to acknowledge from the very onset that what is good for one will not necessarily be for another. Like other people, I chose the hotel based on good reveiws but I must say I was disappointed. Except for the location and some helpful members of staff, in particular one very friendly and extremely helpful young lady, there isn't much that I liked about the hotel especially the room - from the decor to just the ambiance. Although the room was bigger than most of the hotel rooms I've seen or stayed at in Europe, I did not quite like it. The room was not sound proofed, making each and every sound from other rooms very audible including footsteps on a creaky wooden floor from the room above. I'm sure the occupant of the room below me also suffered, as my floor also creaked badly and I was restless for most of the time. I should maybe take some responsibility for not specifically asking for a non-smoking room, but it was as if people on my floor were on a smoking holiday. They would smoke until the small hours of the morning and by day break I would be literally choking. The bed was uncomfortable, 'caved in' and creaky, the pillows equally uncomfortable. I don't know if the heating system was not effective or if it was just me freezing. The lift is quite antique and intersting but it wasn't getting to my floor on some days.I think some travellers will still find the hotel ok, but personally I don't think I'll be returning.

reviews.title: Great Hotel
reviews.text: This place is simply the best for the money. It is really really nice. The room was very clean and good feel to it. There was nothing cheap about the place except the price. It is very convenient to get to, with the train being only around the corner. The room was quiet, no noise from outside. There is a fireplace, apaintings, etc in teh room to look at, so it doesn't feel like one of those plain boring hotels.
I would highly recommend this hotel, it is in a great area, the rooms are very big and clean. The value for money of this hotel is fantastic. Could not fault it
reviews.title: great hotel

reviews.text: Hotel Langlois would have received 5 stars from me if It hadn't been for the fact that we asked to change room. I booked a twin room 7 months in advance of my visit to Paris with my mother for her 75th Birthday & specifically asked for a room with a view. When we arrived we were given a twin room that looked out to a wall and was a bit dingy. Decor was ok, but I was pretty disappointed after reading the rave reviews on tripadvisor and having booked so early with my specific request. The bathroom of the twin room (room 32) was very small and you could quite clearly hear someone splashing around in the bath in the next room.
reviews.title: Great location & good value if you get the right room
Fantastic Hotel
reviews.text: When I asked for an alternative room, the receptionist was very helpful and showed me a number of rooms. There was a small private apartment on the 7th floor with great views, but all modern furniture. Another room had the same view as our twin room but had a double bed & was a bit brighter, but eventually I was shown what I think must have been a suite and that's where we stayed for 3 nights in art nouveau splendour. I was so glad that I had asked to be moved because it made such a difference to our holiday. We had an ornate carved double bed, huge bathroom hidden behind what looked like a cupboard door and our own sitting area. (room 44)

Breakfast at €9 each for continental seemed a bit steep, so we went to the bakery a few doors away for breakfast for 2 people at €4. Fab, safe location - easy to walk to sacre coeur, opera, boulevard Haussman. Good access to metro & RER stations.
reviews.title: If you Dream of a Paris Hotel This Is It

reviews.text: I'd gladly stay at the Langlois again, but would specify a room number if possible and even be willing to pay the extra supplement to guarantee a bigger room.
reviews.title: Great Hotel

description: Built in 1870 and totally renovated in 1997, H0tel Langlois combines the charm of Belle Epoque with today's standards of comfort. Individually decorated spacious rooms offer all modern conveniences. Our rooms and suites are equipped with totally renovated bathrooms and air conditioning. The hotel is located on a quiet street, only a few steps from La Trinite Church. The Opera is also within walking distance.
